==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|Äne|t=without}}, from {{inh|de|goh|Äna}}, {{m|goh|Änu}}, {{m|goh|Äno|t=without}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*Ä“nu}}, {{m|gem-pro|*Ä“nÅ|t=without}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*anew}}, {{m|ine-pro|*enew|t=without}}. Cognate with {{cog|osx|Äno||without}}, {{cog|ofs|Åni||without}}, {{cog|non|Ã¡n}}, {{m|non|Ã³n||without}}, {{cog|grc|á¼„Î½ÎµÏ…||without}}, {{cog|got|ğŒ¹ğŒ½ğŒ¿||without}}. The Gothic word stems from {{cog|gem-pro|*inÅ}}, the other cognates stem from {{cog|gem-pro|*Ä“nÅ}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ËˆoËnÉ™/}} * {{audio|de|De-ohne.ogg|audio}} ===Preposition=== {{de-prep}} # {{lb|de|+accusative}} [[without]] ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|mit}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|ohnedies}} * {{l|de|ohnegleichen}} * {{l|de|ohnehin}} ===Adverb=== {{head|de|adverb}} # [[without]] #: ''Ich mag FuÃŸball, aber ich kann auch '''ohne''' leben.'' #:: I like soccer, but I could live '''without.''' ====Usage notes==== This use as an adverb is standard usage but generally avoided in (very) formal style. ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/ËˆoËnÉ™/}} ===Preposition=== {{head|hrx|preposition}} # {{lb|de|+accusative}} [[without]] #: {{ux|hrx|'''Ohne''' Rehn kannd-maâ€™s net planze.|'''Without''' rain you can not plant it.}} #: {{ux|hrx|Das Esse ist '''ohne''' Salz.|The food is '''without''' salt.}} #: {{ux|hrx|Ich wolld blos en Nacht '''ohne''' das Barullie.|I only wanted one night '''without''' noise.}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|hrx|mit}} ===External links=== * [http://www.hunsrik.org/Lexi/SearchResult?searchStr=aan Online Hunsrik Dictionary]
